meanings.definition: A part of a city, especially a slum area, occupied by a minority group or groups.
meanings.sent1: The ghettoes in our city are where many families live close together.
meanings.sent2: The government is working to improve the living conditions in the ghettoes.
meanings.sent3: I heard a funny joke about the pigeons in the ghettoes having their own mayor.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a maze of dark alleyways, much like the ghettoes of the city.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the bakery wafted through the ghettoes, enticing everyone with its warmth.

meanings.definition: A section of a city, especially a thickly populated slum area, inhabited predominantly by members of an ethnic or other minority group, often as a result of social or economic restrictions.
meanings.sent1: The old buildings in the ghettoes had colorful graffiti on their walls.
meanings.sent2: People from different backgrounds come together in the ghettoes to share their stories.
meanings.sent3: The stray cat seemed to think it was the king of the ghettoes, strutting around confidently.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a crowded street in the ghettoes, full of different emotions and memories.
meanings.sent5: The sound of music echoed through the narrow streets of the ghettoes, bringing joy to all who listened.
